Just FYI, this is a revert of previous changes.

nodes.bodyText:
I know this is simply reverting to what 'was'...
But we could have email address attributes in the CONTACT_ARTIFACT, which should produce an CR attribute.  Perhaps we should make a story to come back and revisit this later.

nodes.bodyText: Motivation for defining the types, and not their negation (by that I mean not keyword hit, not calllog, not contacts), is this will be safer to keep it up to date. Basically, if a new type comes along for correlation only, we are good. If a new type comes along for insert, during testing they (developer) won't see the expected behavior and update this set. However, with the negation, any new artifact types accepted for correlation will automatically be saved, which is too accepting of mistakes.
I think a comment here to indicate that this list should be updated with any new artifacts that may be source for CR attributes (for creation) would be useful.
Good idea, I've added a comment. Thanks.

I realize that the code above is restored code, but it looks like it contains another bug. The contact book entry, call log entry and message artifacts all support multiple phone number attributes. I think we need to loop over all of the attributes in the artifact, rather than stop after "harvesting" one phone number.
See Raman's comment for new story proposal.
@dannysmyda, please create the story or stories, assign to self, etc. Thanks!
I'll just do it here then.
